title.narrative: Promoting the Adaptation and Adoption of RECP (Resource Efficient and Cleaner Production) through the Establishment and Operation of a Cleaner Production Centre (CPC) in Ukraine

description.narrative:
The present project aims at enhancing the resource productivity, competitiveness and environmental performance of industry in Ukraine. It will support the adaptation and adoption of Resource Efficient and Cleaner Production methods, practices, technologies and policies, providing national industries with the necessary tools to facilitate access to national and regional markets with environmentally sound products and improve the ability of national enterprises to successfully negotiate their position in the global market.
The present project has been developed on the basis of the experience that UNIDO and UNEP have gained in establishing Cleaner Production Centres and Programmes in nearly 50 countries worldwide. It builds on the results and lessons learned during the implementation of the UNIDO project for establishing a National Cleaner Production Programme in Ukraine which has been ongoing since 2007. In addition, UNIDO organized an international expert mission to Ukraine at the end of 2009 and two national stakeholder consultation workshops in June and December 2010 which brought together the main ministries, institutions and donors involved in CP-related activities in Ukraine. the outcomes of the above-stated preparatory work and UNIDO’s global expertise enable the definition of the specific requirements for the establishment and organization of the Cleaner Production Centre in Ukraine, which will adopt a sector-based approach, concentrating on national priority sectors, namely chemicals, agro-processing, metallurgical and metal processing industries. The national host institution of the present project will be the National Technical University of Ukraine “Kyiv Polytechnic Institute”.
The Centre will focus its activities on building the capacity of national experts with regard to RECP, implementing RECP assessments and supporting RECP technology projects in companies from the selected priority sectors and regions. A number of specific training and pilot projects on Chemical Leasing will be carried out in Ukraine and in countries from the Black sea area to foster regional cooperation the service based business model of Chemical Leasing will be mainly applied to the sound production, management and application of chemicals.
The CPC-Ukraine will play an important role in coordinating all national RECP efforts and promote partnership links between public and private institutions at national and regional levels. During the preparatory phase of the present project, cooperation arrangements were already defined with the UNDP-GEF funded Dnipro River Ecological Programme and a Cleaner Production and Energy Efficiency Programme funded by Norway. In addition, close cooperation links will be set up with the upcoming GEF-funded UNIDO project “Improving Energy Efficiency and Promoting Renewable Energy in the Agro-Food and other Small and Medium Enterprises in Ukraine”.
Furthermore, special emphasis will be placed on enhancing cooperation with financial institutions, and supporting RECP technology development and transfer for more effective market access. Joint training and information activities are planned with IFC and local representatives of the World Bank that will be invited as guest to the national Advisory Board. In this manner, the proposed project responds to Goal 7, Ensure environmental sustainability, and Goal 8, Develop a global partnership for development, of the United Nations Millennium Development Goals. The project duration will be five years and two main phases are foreseen. The first Phase will cover three years and will include a 12 months inception phase to develop the Centre’s business plan and its legal structure. KPI together with the CPC staff will be entrusted with the establishment and final setup of the legal structure.
To ensure nationwide coverage and up-scaling, the CPC will work with regional RECP Focal Points in seven regions of Ukraine: Kiev Region, Kharkiv, Krym (Crimea)/Kherson, Luhansk, Lviv, Vinnytsia and Zaporizhia. The regional RECP Focal Points will be coordinated by the main office of the CPC in Kiev. Their main tasks will be to organize training and assessment activities in the respective regions and to build up local RECP know-how. The Focal Points will be managed by local coordinators who are familiar with the specific situation in the region and are qualified to establish close links with industry and local government. During Phase I, the three already existing Focal Points in Kiev Region, Vinnytsia and Zaporizhia will be further strengthened and a new one will be established in the region of Luhansk. After this period, the project will be evaluated to analyze its progress and readjust it – if required – for Phase II which will cover the remaining project duration. During Phase II, it is envisaged that three additional Focal Points will be set up in the regions of Krym (Crimea), Kharkiv and Lviv.
